The dirty, smelly room was lit with a cheap neon light. Inside were a man and a woman drying her black hair.\nThe man barked a bare-faced lie, and the woman blindly believed it.\nSad scenes such as these are common wherever you go.
The woman knew the man had been lying from the start.\nBut she lied to herself, insisting that\n"if you don't believe it's a lie, it won't be."
A luxurious dinner in a three star hotel.\nThe man treated the woman well until she let him have her body.\nAs their rendezvous lost its novelty, the man began to stray.

The woman, who had used her youth as a weapon,
was left with nothing after it faded away.
And so, she desperately clung to the man
with the part of her that he had loved most...
She clung to him and squeezed.

My father had the power to change something precious into something special, an ability which my proud mother often praised.\nHe was a blacksmith revered in the west, and I'd always regarded him with pride.

Once my father started working on a particular piece, he wouldn't let a living soul into his workshop. His own family was no exception.\nWhat he did must have taken an immense amount of concentration.\nI understood that much, as young as I was, and imagining him hard at work helped me resist my more childish impulses.

Having respected my father more than anyone else in the world, it was only natural that I would want to follow in his footsteps.
So when it was decided that I would become a live-in apprentice at a well-known workshop, I rushed home to tell him the news.
I was on top of the world that day.
That's how I ended up barging right into his workshop while he was busy working.

I witnessed my father at work for the first time.
What I saw was nothing like I had imagined countless times before. I was at a loss for words.
"Now, it's your turn."
It was the first words I'd heard out of him in forever.
Hearing that short sentence, I finally understood the price he paid for his abilities.

"A key imbued with incredibly strong...desire...will appear.
And I will need you to do work on it for me."
From the day I received these mysterious powers, I started hearing an unpleasant voice in my head.
I didn't exactly want to listen to it, but I felt compelled to do its bidding for whatever reason.

One day, the suspicious voice started telling me the secrets of the world.\nIt was a list of phenomena so bizarre that most people would never believe it.\nI didn't think I'd believe it, either, but after several hours, the words began to ring true, so I set out to find a workshop to do the voice's bidding.

I did as I was told and spent my days making magnificent weapons.
Important things were lost with each one I finished.
The sadness of losing things that brightened my world chipped away at my heart.
But I could not deny the rate at which my skills improved...
Even if it left me with a heart haunted by warped desires.

My wife of many years.
My son who loved and respected me so much.
My very best friend.
A beauty I was once passionately in love with.
I sacrificed all of the important things I could think of,
but I ultimately came up one short.
I knew what the last important thing was.
I said a few words of gratitude to the...precious things...I used as materials
and completed my task with one last swing.
An old woman walked with a staff that resembled a long tree branch.\n"That's not how you use a long stick," I told her,\nand I showed her the right way to play with one!

After I was done playing with the old woman, a greasy old man called out as if he also wanted to play.\nHe seemed proud of his "long stick" skills, which he felt obliged to show me, but really, I didn't think his backbone was all that long. Too bad.

Yet again, a man with a long stick stood before me.
His breathing was forced, and he kept yelling at me about something to do with getting revenge for the old woman.
Is today national Long Stick Day or something?
Beats me...

Day eventually turned to night.
I was alone again.
"Mine is the best 'long stick,'" I thought.
And with that, I grabbed my long stick, and gripped it tight so I'd never lose it.

The kind king was the pride of the entire kingdom.\nWitnessing him chat with the queen and princess always brought smiles to the faces of all who saw them.\nThe queen suffered from a serious illness, but the feisty princess never allowed her parents a single moment to give into despair.

Three winters later, tragedy struck at last.
The queen succumbed to her illness and died.
The king cried for a day and a night, but his tears dried at the princess' playful jests.
He could smile, so long as he still had her.
But if she were to die, who would be left to warm his heart and quiet his doubts?

The kingdom's darkest fears soon came to pass.
One day without warning, the princess succumbed to the same illness as her mother and died.
The king wept relentlessly.
It was then that he realized—
He had no family left to ease him with a smile.

So it was that he turned to an ominous ceremony.\nIf it meant he could get the smiles of his queen and princess back, he was willing to sacrifice everything.\nAnd from that day forth, this dark ritual was held in a prison...

Adherent's Note ①\nThe person with the strongest desire has power in this world, be they nightmares or otherwise.\nSo if nightmares were to fight one another, exactly how much desire do you think the final survivor would possess?
Adherent's Note ②\nIs it possible to create an energy that defies all scientific law?\nIn truth, the physical makeup of nightmares possesses properties that go way beyond our wildest imaginations.

Adherent's Note ③
My research has come to a standstill.
The phenomena occur too randomly. Such fluctuations in the findings are simply too great, and results supporting my hypothesis appear at a negligible rate.
However, the princess has resumed breathing.

Adherent's Note ④
I don't know if you can call this living or not...
But now it's your turn. Oh, how I yearn for you.
My queen, even if you won't have anything resembling a heart,
I'll at least get to see you move one more time.

Guard's Testimony ①
Thanks to the king's magnificent governance, the kingdom flourished, and the population swelled.
But a famine left
the kingdom on the verge of collapse.

Guard's Testimony ②
But then—around the time the princess fell ill, was it?
People started disappearing on dark, misty days.
My own son was among them...
Guard's Testimony ③\nThey say the king was performing rituals to resurrect the princess.

Guard's Testimony ④
Once I've made my preparations, I'll head for the prison, too.
It's my duty to figure out what exactly is going on in there—
Not just as a father, but as a loyal servant to the king...

There was once a sword that could cut anything in half.\nA band of adventures who struggled to defeat an evil dragon found the sword, and the swordsman among them used it to split the dragon clean in two.

The adventurers found treasures of gold and silver piled in the dragon's nest.\nIt was too much to carry on their own, so they left to get help. Consumed by greed, the swordsman cut the suspension bridge on the way back.\nHis companions fell to their deaths at the bottom of the ravine.
The swordsman kept the treasure for himself and became wealthy beyond imagining.\nBut one day, an anonymous letter claiming "I know what you did" arrived at his mansion.
The swordsman, consumed with paranoia, fell ill.\nOne day, he decided to cut all of his servants in half.\nHe was promptly arrested and beheaded with his own sword.

The people who lived in the region deified Mother Earth and lived in harmony with her.\nIn the great forest near their settlement stood Yggdrasil, a towering tree well over 1,000 years old where many of the people prayed.
One day, another clan came through the forest to invade.\nBut the forest sensed their evil intent and led them astray.\nExhausted, they eventually gave up and returned home.

In time, the people stopped showing gratitude to the great forest, and Yggdrasil was reduced to tinder.\nThe clan once again invaded, this time from another direction, and the people fled into the forest for refuge.\nThe clan was notorious for cutting the tendons of prisoners to prevent escape, and those they captured were treated no better than cattle.

A fire rose out of nowhere to burn the great forest to the ground. All of the inhabitants of the settlement were burned alive.\nThe clan left in a rage, their bounty once more stolen from them.\nAnd so the great forest spared its former worshippers once more.
The town had a capable sheriff who kept a crossbow in a holster on his hip.\n"I'll protect this town without ever having to use this," he declared.
Later that day, the bank was being robbed, and the sheriff rushed to the scene.\nHe threatened them with his crossbow. They turned tail and ran away.

The robbers broke into a jeweler's mansion and barricaded themselves inside.\nThe sheriff rushed to the scene and appeared before the robbers.\nRumors that he'd "never use his crossbow" finally reached the thieves' ears, making his threats no more than empty bluster.

Seeing the sheriff with crossbow in hand, one robber yelled, "Does that crossbow even shoot?!"\nAs they spoke, other officers broke through the back and tied up the robbers.\nThe sheriff smiled. "It doesn't need to."

The composer was a prodigy from birth, but abuse at the hands of his foster parents had made him so anxious that he lived a life of obscurity.\nNevertheless, a showman found the prodigy and offered him an incredible contract.\nThankful beyond words, the composer vowed that his new patron would not regret his kindness.

Thanks to the showman, the composer's songs started to sell, and his life of misfortune seemed to be finally behind him.\nHowever, a beautiful woman soon set her gaze upon his wealth, and did everything in her power to get between him and his manager.\nIt was on her advice that the composer canceled the contract with the showman to whom he had been so grateful.

After his lover sucked him dry of every last drop of talent, he gambled away what money remained and went bankrupt.
His lover wasted no time in leaving him for another man.
Realizing the error of his ways, he apologized to the showman.
"You had a lot to offer before. Now? You're just a shadow of your former self," said the showman, rejecting him.

The composer put everything he had left into a new composition, sent it to the showman, and locked himself in his bathroom.\nWhen he was seen next, his limbs had been cut with harp strings and he was bleeding to death in his bathtub.\nThe showman's "Last Work of a Tragic Prodigy" achieved unprecedented sales.

They understood.
They knew that the amount of evil in the world hadn't waned.
And yet, the ruler still
put criminals in prison...
A desperate, desperate attempt to avert everyone's eyes from the truth.
And yet, many with evil in their hearts roamed free.\n"There's no way to figure out who they are until they do something bad," it's said.
They mimic the good and are only increasing in numbers.\nDarkness spreads at an alarming rate, and soon will shroud the entire world.\nNone believe it will end peacefully.
When the chains of evil are finally broken.\nThat's when they'll realize the error of their ways.\n...The day the bells of demise echo across the land draws near.

The man was born to be a murderer and killed as easily as he drew breath.\nHe was eventually captured and had the mark of the death branded upon his forehead.\nThe night before he was set to die, Death appeared with a scythe in hand and said, "Your life will end tomorrow."

"I'm innocent," the prisoner said. "I can't die like this... I know! Make me into a reaper. Do that, and I'll gather proof of my innocence."\nDeath sympathized with him, agreed to do what he asked, and handed him his scythe.

Now a proper reaper, the prisoner broke out of his cell and went on a killing spree.\nNot long after, he was captured by an archangel and imprisoned in heaven.\nThe night before he was set to die, an angel appeared with a scythe in hand and said, "Your life will end tomorrow."

"I'm innocent," the prisoner said. "I can't die like this. I know! Make me into an angel. Do that, and I'll gather proof of my innocence."\nPossessed of both the powers of heaven and hell, the convict continues his path of slaughter to this day.

A blacksmith collected molten metal from the depths of a volcano, crafted a sword, and named it the Sword of Burned Metal.\nHe gave it to an ambitious young man as a parting gift when he decided to leave town.

The young man later took part in a tournament at the capital. He fought bravely, even in the face of superior adversaries.\nA commanding officer was impressed with his valor and recommended that he be given command of a hundred men.

An insurrection broke out, and the young man led his unit into battle.
As soon as they arrived, enemy cavalry appeared before them and began to jeer.
The man was consumed with rage and rode off to meet them on his own.
His subordinates, mistaking his actions for an all-out attack, followed close behind.

The young man's unit found themselves totally exposed to the enemy's assault.\nUnable to fathom why the man would put his unit in such a vulnerable position, his second-in-command stabbed him in the back.\nWith the Sword of Burned Metal still in hand, the man fell to the ground, his blood boiling.

When the girl opened her eyes, she had no idea where she was. An icy sense of loss sunk into her chest. Though she couldn't say why, she was clutching a violin.\n"Such a warm melody..."\nThough she was sure she was playing it poorly, the sound of the strings was sweet and brought her solace.

The dragon village strictly forbade contact with humans.
So when the dragon saw the girl being attacked by thieves, he knew he should've flown away.
Alas, his heart compelled him to save her, breaking his people's sacred law.
"Why did I do that?"
That simple question seemed to have no simple answer.

That was how the girl and the dragon first met.
He had every intention of flying away as soon as the girl was safe, but he kept putting it off.
First until she got home.
Then until she found work...
He always found new reasons to stick around.

In time, he came to realize the real reason he stayed with her.
It was the truth that finally convinced him it was time to leave.
He had let his feelings for her grow too strong.
As a parting gift, he turned part of his own body into a violin and flew away.

[Artifact Research Section - Memorandum]
The imperial tank and catapult units are a risk that needs to be dealt with.
There's no two ways about it.
Developing artifacts will do more to strengthen our country than relying on heavy weapons.

[Artifact A Inquiry]\nImbued with a thunder spirit, Artifact A made short work of the imperial tank and catapult units by blasting them with lightning from above.\nIt served its purpose well, but some users have taken to using it to blow open the doors of vaults, shatter the locks of treasure chests, and other such unlawful actions.

[Artifact A Improvements]
We've restricted its use to military applications, and have begun making enhancements.
The artifact can now shoot lightning from a greater distance.
More importantly, we are confident it will no longer get into the hands of those who would abuse its powers.

[Artifact A Dash Questions]\nArtifact A / "Distant Spinel" has been reborn as a military weapon, but thieves have since stolen the blueprints for the weapon, using them to cause all manner of chaos.\nMeasures must be taken to combat this at once.

The wizard went to the island where a reaper resided and stood on the precipice of hell.\nWhen he didn't come back, everyone thought him dead.\nSeveral years later, he emerged from an underground spring with a staff that could control the dead.

Now armed with the staff's gruesome abilities, the wizard stopped eating and rarely went out in the daylight.\nHe lost weight, turned pale, and began to look more and more like the lifeless beings he commanded.

Night after night, he roamed the streets.\nHis favorite spot was a cemetery on the outskirts of town. There, he would stand perfectly still and listen, his heart at peace with the world.\nHis heart overflowed with compassion for the many corpses buried underground.

As he was standing in the cemetery, the corpses began to rise from the ground.
"Come forth, my brethren!" He smiled, pointing his staff to the ground.
More and more corpses fought their way to the surface and crowded around him...
The next morning, his suffocated corpse was discovered among the rotten flesh, his face frozen in ecstasy.

On realizing he was destined to never set foot on the firm ground of reality, he (she) was proud to delve into a sea of passive emptiness instead. His faith within this ocean merged with a false self to create imperceptible shackles of the psyche.

Egocentrism is the true nature of all living things. We decided to define her by this false self. We also made the choice to start researching the problems that arise when false reality meets other ridiculous assumptions accepted as "truth."

The deviation mentioned in the previous thesis is grounded in the self-isolating and self-centered nature of his ego. I've concluded that his protective instinct kicks in whenever self-preservation is required. In other words, the false assumptions he (she) accepts as "truth."

Ultimately, the collapse of his self-satisfying "perceived superiority" will close the gap between his ego and true self, and the self-suppression of the self-isolating ego will occur to a greater extent. He will try to forget and will fail, trapped in a cycle of self-preserving actions.
We're very sorry, teacher.\nWe forced you to do this for us.
Oh, I know.\nI know what supper's made from.
I first noticed it\nwhen I ate my big sister.\nShe might've looked different, but I still knew.
She was so, so tasty.\nAnd I loved my big brother even more.\nSo I really want to try tasting him.
I saw it.\nI saw teacher's body hanging at night.
I saw it.\nI saw my mommy cleaning up the place real fast.
I saw it.\nI saw my mommy cooking up teacher's body.
I ate it. I ate teacher's body.\nAnd I knew. Meat from human bodies is tasty.
I think I always knew.\nI knew the real reason you went crazy.
There weren't enough.\nNot enough kids died naturally.
So you started killing kids.\nFor the sake of the kids.

You died and I took your place.
I know just how you felt.
I think I've gone pretty crazy too.
I was spaced out all day again.
So spaced out that the food I got ran away.

Our motherland was never on good terms with its neighbors, constantly involved in one skirmish or another. But ever since that fateful day, our nation found itself in a position of inferiority. The pressure was crushing.\nWe learned through a spy's report that a new arms-development process had been delivered to the hands of an enemy nation. That is why our king summoned me. As a prominent arms developer, I would prove the perfect counter.

Under the king's patronage, I began applying myself to the development of new weapons.\nAs the war grew more intense, these arms were sent straight to the battlefield, complete with flaws. Yes, they exploded on our own troops and resulted in several casualties...\nBut our neighbors grew concerned and began to pull back.

Although war had been avoided, I proposed to the king that I continue to develop these weapons. We may have been saved by the instincts of our enemy, but we couldn't count on being so lucky again.\nThe king did not agree. "We must rescue the commoners who have been ravaged by war," he said, allocating none of his budget towards arms development.

How could our nation establish any permanent policy this way? I've thus resolved to display my new weapon right on Main Street when the king visits.
Its name? The Explosive Javelin.
Hah! Now this is sure to change even a mind as stubborn as his!
...N-No, my assistant! Wait! I've yet to make my final calibrations, you mustn't fiddle with—

A true hero, he had mastered every martial art. He now counseled the throne, putting everything he had into crushing the neighboring country's forces.\nBut the king was not one for excessive bloodshed, and opted instead to make peace with the enemy. So it was that the hero parted ways with the king in order to conquer his own path.

The hero's struggles bore fruit, and soon none could rival him. With the neighboring forces destroyed, he returned to banish his own king.\nHe declined the throne, however, instead becoming head of the military. It was his hand that would choose the next king, he who would become first in a line of figureheads.

The new king was a weak-willed, talentless ingrate. Eventually, his scheming retainers planned to remove the hero so as to take power for themselves. The idiot king believed their slander and tried to behead the hero. Left with no other option, the hero slayed both the king and his retainers, taking both the throne and the title of Conqueror for himself.

His favor with the people plummeted. A quick series of rebellions followed, each rising on the tail of the last. His allies folded easily, and he knew not what to do. Finding himself more alone than ever, he took to the battlefield and slew his enemies with a bellowing laugh.\nThe Conqueror will surely return one day, blade in hand.

The adventurers searched the ruins, where they discovered an exquisite jug.\nNext to it was a piece of parchment that read, "Here lies sealed the Jug of Death, a cursed and sacred treasure that ends the life of its holder."\nThey took both it and the parchment to a merchant and sold them off for a hefty sum.

A man who'd heard rumors of the jug bought it on the spot.
The butler to a noble family, he was engaged in an affair with his master's wife, and so he plotted to kill him.
"I found this for an incredible bargain," he told the master of the house, who gleefully took it from his hands to display in his bedchamber.
Yet the noble remained the very picture of health no matter how much time passed. Nothing seemed to threaten his wellbeing.
Annoyed, the butler snuck out with the jug and returned it to the merchant.

Another man bought the jug next.
A knight serving a provincial lord, he wished to visit divine punishment upon his master who so persecuted his subjects.
Yet he could not bring himself to kill the man to whom he once devoted his sword. Only a natural death would do.
He gave the jug as an offering to his lord, who gleefully took it from his hands to display in his parlor. Once again, this would-be victim remained in perfect health.
Disappointed, the knight resigned his post and returned to the countryside.

After being passed through countless hands, the jug was returned to the original merchant. Having witnessed its failure so many times, he decided to keep it for himself.
That night, his wife discovered his adulterous ways and sent him to the afterlife with a dagger between the ribs.
How could the merchant have known of the mysterious, unsolved deaths visited upon the noble with the unchaste wife and the greedy provincial lord?
Indeed, the Jug of Death's curse was as real as it was inscrutable.
Thou shalt not eat thy own kind.\n—Scripture of the Dead, Chapter 2: Verse 3
Thou shalt watch for rot and must never bring displeasure to others.\n—Scripture of the Dead, Chapter 3: Verse 1
Thou shalt not be dissolved in holy water.\nThou shalt not bend to the power of the cross.\n—Scripture of the Dead, Chapter 5: Verse 2
Nothing threatens the living more than celerity.\nTrain hard each and every day, and always be sure to give chase at maximum speed.\nScripture of the Dead, Miscellaneous Notes
[Method #1]\nWait to approach when target begins to descend the stairs, then push them down. A simple maneuver, certainly, but lethality is not guaranteed.

[Method #2]\nFind a reason to accompany the target when they go on a long trip, then wait for the right moment to kick their horse from behind.\nThe shocked horse will run wild. High chance of broken neck if the horse decides to buck.

[Method #3]
Drip poison from the bedroom ceiling into target's mouth, day by day.
Enough accumulated in the body will deform blood vessels, causing sudden heart failure.
Requires determination, but it is both reliable and difficult to detect.

My hands tremble as they hold the notebook. This handwriting... Whose is it?\nI left the kitchen to question my servants. My heart throbbed, and I began to feel dizzy. Was Method #3 already underway? To think that I'd have to fear assassination for the rest of my life...
Awww... I'm so bored!\nBored, bored, bored!
Won't someone play with me?\nPlay with me, play with me, play with me!
C'mon out already!\nParrah? Noya? I don't care who! I just want someone to play with!
Guh... Great, now I'm hungry.\nGet outta here! You're in the way.

The boy was kind and docile, a child who shied away from conflict.\nIronically, it was his nonconfrontational nature that allowed him to be tyrannized by the other children. Bullies showered him with beatings, and seldom a day went by without him getting kicked or punched.
One day, the battered boy was walking home, one leg dragging behind the other, when an old man appeared.\n"Use this if you wish to get revenge, boy." The man handed the child a handgun.

Day after day, the boy was brought to an empty lot for a beating at the hands of his bullies.\nAt last, the hammer within his heart fell. He brought the gun out from his pocket, pointed it at the boys surrounding him, and pulled the trigger.

But instead of a bullet, confetti flew from the barrel. The old man jumped out of hiding and laughed.
"I can't believe it! You actually took that joke seriously?!" The bullies laughed right along with him.
The boy flew into a rage unlike anything he'd ever felt before and beat both the old man and the bullies to death with the butt of the gun.
The reporter that later came to the scene of the carnage signed off with this telling quote: "Within every heart hides a gun, loaded and ready."

Long ago, there was an emperor who unified the human world by force. It was said that this ruler was able to glimpse the throne of the gods, and in his jealousy attempted to wage war with the heavens.\nAfter many bloody battles, the gods came to him with a peace treaty.\nThe gods officially recognized the emperor and each of his ancestors as the sovereign of all he saw. They bestowed upon him an axe as the symbol of his hegemony.

The current emperor was a small man whose hobby was building vaults. Though an adequate ruler, the man had an inferiority complex owing to the long line of great emperors that preceded him.\nOne day, he noticed that the axe symbolizing his hegemony had disappeared from the court. The emperor was furious.\nHis men looked everywhere for the axe but could not find it. Each new messenger who returned with another unfavorable report was slain on the spot.

The search for the axe was fruitless, each failed attempt another mockery of the frantic emperor.\nIt wasn't long before the messengers no longer reported to him, so afraid were they for their lives. The emperor then turned his ire to the searchers themselves, beheading them to the man.\n"Only someone close to me could have accomplished such a heist..." His suspicions continued to grow, spurring him to oust one chief vassal after the next.

Then, it dawned upon him—The night he'd drank himself into a stupor, taken the axe from the wall, and...placed it in one of his vaults. Fearing the pandemonium that would occur should this truth come to light, the emperor elected to keep quiet.\nBut he betrayed himself a second time, letting word of his blunder slip to a favored concubine. Word spread like a raging fire, and it wasn't long before his vassals joined together to slay him in a fit of righteous anger.
There once was a street performer with a beloved flute.\nHis bold performances filled the people who heard him with courage.

A young man came to the performer and asked, "I want to bravely fight and die for our nation. Play me a song before I leave for the battlefront."\nHe was extolled as a hero after his incredible service in the war.
Rumors of the performer began to spread.\nOne day while playing on the street, a man came to ask if he would play for his son who would not leave his room.
The performer met the man's son and played for him.\nThe boy exclaimed, "My body's bursting with courage!" He the ran up to the roof before giving a bannister a mighty kick and leaping to his death.

There was once a quick-witted dealer of second-hand goods.\nHe worked his way into the good graces of his nation's prime minister, who held more influence than the king. Various doors would open for him...for a price.

The prime minister fell victim to an epidemic and died. His family and retainers were executed by the new king.\nThe merchant went to greet the new king, bringing with him a gift of some value.\nHis generosity pleased the crown, and the man was made purveyor to the new king.

The new king's lifestyle soon turned lavish, drawing his attention away from the political sphere.\nWhen it became clear neighboring countries were plotting an invasion, the merchant colluded with them, selling classified information to the enemy.\nThe royal capital fell to the invasion, and the new king was executed.

The merchant went to visit the neighboring country's king.\nHis court magus told the king, "Your Majesty, please allow me to deal with him."\nWhen the king agreed, the magus cast a spell. This transformed the merchant into a form that better suited him—a weathervane, which tumbled to the ground and smashed into pieces on the spot.
[Regarding an ancient ruin]\nJust a bit of searching has revealed more treasure here than we could possibly have imagined.
[Regarding an ancient ruin (contd.)]\nWhat's more, it looks as though we've beaten any robbers here. This truly is a new discovery.
[Regarding an ancient ruin (addendum)]\nDespite all of this treasure, there are barely any wandering nightmares.\nI'm pleased to say we'll be able to search these remains to our heart's content.

Welcome, you covetous fools!\nMy sincere thanks to you for not doubting the absurdity of an untouched ancient ruin filled with treasure.\nAllow me to show you my gratitude with a gift—the honor of becoming sacrifices for our dark lord!
There was once a magician called Guru who was respected by all.\nWith his dying words, he passed both his title and his beloved staff on to his disciple.
The second-generation Guru took a disciple of his own.\nHowever, he chose poorly, and the disciple eventually killed him. The new disciple then stole the staff and named himself the third Guru.

The third-generation Guru took a disciple as well, intending to pass on the staff and title like before.\nWhat he didn't know was that the second Guru had a son, who avenged his father by striking down the third Guru. The prodigal child then took the staff, thus taking his place as the fourth Guru.

Hah! Oh, how foolish you humans are.
You believe you struggle, fight, and die for the title of Guru, but the truth is always just beyond your reach...
It is I who pushes you to murder!
Now, go! Don't stop! Keep killing!
How do people survive when they're so off their guard?\nYou can get right behind 'em\nand they don't even notice.
Even dogs and cats'll run as soon as they sense danger.\nHumans are just so easy to kill.
Gosh! This is such an easy job!\nWhy don't people do this more often?\nIt pays so much better than some exhausting daily grind.

Humans are weird.
So very strange.
I'm not the weird one.
Yet humans call me weird.
Why can't they see it for themselves?

"Take that cane and strike down our heretical foes," said the holy father as he handed the cane to his priest, now a pagan inquisitor.\nHe thanked the holy father for giving him this great duty, determined to judge all who stood opposed to his god.

An old woman was brought before the pagan inquisitor.
She'd kidnapped and imprisoned a neighboring child to carry out fiendish experiments.
The inquisitor gathered every shred of evidence
and proclaimed her a witch.
She was sent to be burned at the stake.

The pagan inquisitor later judged a woman.
Finding herself in dire straits, she had been unable to raise her own children without resorting to the basest profession of all. Thankfully, the church had exposed her parlor.
Though her relatives and neighbors begged him for clemency, the inquisitor turned a deaf ear.
She was proclaimed a witch and sent to be burned at the stake.

An epidemic swept across the land. The head of an afflicted village was brought in front the inquisition, charged with selling holy relics to raise money for treatment.
The pagan inquisitor deemed this an act of sacrilege and sent him to be burned at the stake.
On his way back from the execution grounds, the inquisitor was dragged into a back alley and beheaded.
The following words were carved into his cane: "The greatest heretic of all shall find judgment in the streets."

[The Convict's Confession]\nThe man claims that when he passed the victim, their arms collided and they began to quarrel.\nAfter the argument, he drew his sword and sliced through the victim's neck, beheading him.

[The Convict's Plea]
Honestly, I don't know why I let my resentment turn the trivial into the troublesome.
It may sound irresponsible of me, but it's the honest truth.
I would just like to ask that you show forgiveness.

[The Head Vigilante's Diary]
I discovered something when I showed the sword to a priest.
It seems that within it lies the soul of a murderer whose resentment caused him to cut down everyone around him.
But we've confiscated it now. That should be the end of it.

[The Executioner's Final Moments]
Where's that convict's sword? Ugh, and I was thinking of pawning it off to help pay for my bar tab.
Hmm? Wait... Where did you get that...?
H-Hold on a second... Why are you looking at me like that?!
S-Stop it! I only ever hit you out of love! As your father, I...
D-Don't––!

There was once a black knight who was feared by all for his military prowess both on and off the battlefield.\nWhat's more, he boasted a comprehensive understanding of magic. He called upon his abilities to slay the king and support the young prince, whom he served as a guardian.\nNot a soul dared oppose their rule.

Patriotic soldiers gathered in secret to discuss how to defeat the black knight.\nYet, overthrowing the man seemed impossible. His strength was terrifying... Demonic, even.\nAs they struggled, a merchant appeared and told them, "Just let me deal with the black knight."

The merchant received an audience with the black knight and offered him a gem.
"I gift unto thee a gem that grants three wishes," he said.
A genie appeared when the knight took the gem. "Your three wishes, my master."
For his first wish, the delighted black knight asked for eternal youth.

Ever concerned about his frightening appearance,
the black knight then wished for a pleasant countenance along with limitless magical energy.
The genie bowed and said, "As you command!"
A moment later, the black knight had been turned into a doll.
From that day onward, he was passed from person to person as a charm, beloved by all.

The only notable thing about the young man was his size. His parents ever claimed that he ate more food than he deserved, and rained insults and blows upon him.\nOne day, the owner of the local inn appeared on their doorstep. "I'd like to hire your son," he said.\nThe next day, the giant went to work at the inn.

The innkeeper gave the giant a hand axe and told him to chop firewood.
He chopped a large pile in no time at all.
The innkeeper praised him, treating him to a feast as a reward.
Never in his life had the giant been commended, and he was moved to tears.

Wicked-looking men appeared one day and attacked the innkeeper.\nMoneylenders to whom the man was indebted, they came to hurt him nearly every day.\nThe giant was enraged when he saw them beating his benefactor. Taking the axe in his hands, he demolished the assailants' skulls.

The giant was arrested. His dull mind prevented him from explaining the motive of his crime, and he was therefore given a life sentence.\nThe innkeeper came to visit the giant in prison and spoke to him warmly. It took all his effort not to break into song.\nAfter all, the giant had been the perfect pawn to wipe out all his debts.

One day, a man watched as his homeland was consumed by flame. His loving parents, the girl next door he'd fancied, his peaceful life... All taken from him.\nThat day, the black knight of vengeance was born.

His journey took him across the land, where he was quick to make—and slay—countless foes. So many, in fact, that the armor protecting his body began to reek of the blood that stained it.\nStill, a girl he met on his travels begged him, "Live with me." But he did not take her hand.

The black knight eventually tracked down the mastermind of the fire.
The arsonist wept and clung to the knight, begging for his life...but that would not stay the knight's avenging blade.
As he looked upon the mangled corpse, the black knight could hear the sound of crying.
It seemed that even this wretch of a man had someone who loved him.

But even vengeance could no longer sate his blade.
Some he killed for a price; others, for fun. Murder was the only thing that filled the void in his heart, but never for long.
One day, a man appeared before the knight.
"With your death, I will finally have revenge!"
Strange... The man bore an uncanny resemblance to a sworn enemy he'd slain long ago...
My father raised me all on his own.\nIt was only natural that I began to help him out. It was a way for me to repay the man who had always been there for me.

My father was a blacksmith, but he was held back by his awkwardness. He had trouble selling his products, despite their quality. Unable to take it any longer, I began to sell his work for him, and soon his weapons flew off the shelves.

However, my father had stopped working recently.
It started out as a break for his health,
but it wasn't long before I began to worry about our future.
Fearing for our fate,
I decided to be strict with my father.

The next day, I found my father's cold body on the floor of his workshop.
All he had left was a brand new spear and a letter written in a dirty scrawl.

My tears flowed freely well into the night.

When I woke in the morning, a child I'd never seen before stood in front of me holding a sword too big for his body.
"Mornin', Dad!"
He shot a carefree smile before running in my direction.
The fact I had no recollection of this child shook me to my core.
Not only that, he carried such a large sword.
It sent chills down my spine.

The child regarded my terror with a confused look.
Concern was written across his small face.
"What's wrong, Dad? You're acting strange."
I burst into an angry rant. By the time my head had cooled, the child was gone.
I opened the door with trepidation, only to find the child sitting by the garden, sword in his arms.

I finally decided to hear the child's story.
I had taken him into my care when I'd stumbled on him wandering with nowhere to call home. He had been living with me for over a month. I even confirmed this story with several of my friends.
It was all true.
It seemed I had forgotten everything about our time together.

But how could I possibly raise a child?
There was simply no way.
One night as the boy slept, I picked him up, his small arms still clutching the giant sword.
I carried him all the way to the mountains, where I left him before returning home.
Yet, cruelest of fates, that's when I began to remember my time with the child.
I recalled the bonds that had formed between us, and tears stung my eyes as they fell. "Ah... So that's what happened..."
Overcome by regret, I ran back to where I'd abandoned the child.
I ran and ran, even after I'd realized the boy was nowhere to be found...

"This is a boat for three. There's no room for you."
Jerks. There was clearly space left for me to sit.
The other boys returned my wounded stare with satisfied grins.
That sight is now carved deep into my heart, returning unbidden no matter how hard I try to forget.

That anger changed something in me.\n"I'll get back at them...some day." That thought motivated me more than any other.\nI began to work hard in my studies, and by the time I was a young man, I'd grown to be the envy of all who saw me.

Days and months passed, and soon I found a job where I could earn money through the labor of others.
I knew just what to do with those funds. Building a sturdy ship became my life's mission.
"The water level on this island is climbing every year.
I'm sure the day will come when I'll need this boat."
Zealous determination was the engine that drove me forward.

At long last, the day had come.
The birds had left the island en masse, and intense rain, the likes of which we had never seen before, poured from the heavens day after day. Certain that the island would sink, I boarded my ship.
Other men, of course, came from their homes as if to board themselves.
"This is a boat for one. There's no room for any of you." I said with a wealth of emotions, pulling the oars in my hands to brush away my bitter past.

The village had a custom where each child received a small bird from the elder on their tenth birthday.\nOne boy had received a beautiful, blue-winged bird.\nHe gave it a name and promised to care for it.

Many days passed before the boy woke to the bird's chirping. It was morning, and they rushed to the woods to eat together.\nThe boy and his bird spent all their time together, growing stronger each day.
When the boy turned fifteen, he was summoned by the elder.\nThe gorgeous bird stood on his shoulder, well-behaved.\nThe elder then told him of the ritual needed to make him a man.
The boy wailed as he strangled the bird.\nBy the time he tore its brilliant wings and consumed its blood, the boy had already accepted the life he would lead as a hunter.

There was once a noble archer who served a temple. He had a beautiful wife, and the two of them made a stunning couple.\nOne day, the lover of the archbishop was killed. Furious, the holy man delivered a notice.\n"I will give whomever captures the culprit anything they want."

Enraged by this unjust murder, the archer began to investigate. However, he could find no notable evidence.\nOne night, the archer visited a pub. The younger brother of his wife was there, and the two shared drinks and spoke for the first time in ages.

The next day, the archer found himself imprisoned.
A government official appeared and explained to him that a split personality of his had been committing murder after murder.
His wife, who had the misfortune of seeing this, asked her brother to get him blackout drunk and arrest him.
The archer's pleas were futile, and he was soon executed.

"That went well."\n"Indeed."\nThe archer's wife and the archbishop smirked. The two had been committing adultery, and when the archbishop's lover pressed him for marriage, he plotted to kill her before eliminating the archer as well. His wife brought the archbishop into the bedchamber, where her husband's bow adorned the wall. Their immoral relationship was finally free to continue.
I may be unlucky, but that's okay. However, I do not have the courage to bring bad luck into my environment.\nAll I can do is act in misfortune when immorality is close by.
If it is true, you can place yourself in unlucky environments. I drifted through schooling and got a mediocre job. I ate and was vain like everyone else.
You see a contradiction.\nIndeed. I agree with you.\nBut humans are creatures of contradictions. Big contradictions and small contradictions.

I am much more sensitive to my own misfortunes.
I don't care about the misfortune of others.
Do you think I'm broken?
Well, I'm not. This is just how the world is.
But it's a very boring human who doesn't have some emotions that deviate from society's standards.
The emperor who follows the path of might sits in the north.\nThe emperor who follows the path of justice sits in the south.\nWith opposing views, they clash violently.

In both lands there were many who excelled at battle and the morale of the troops were high.\nThe war continued for many years with neither giving an inch.\nThe people grew tired and started to rebel against their lords.

God saw what was happening and sent an angel.\nThe angel pierced the two warring lords with a single strike.\nHowever, the crown prince of the east, who had been attempting to broker a ceasefire, was also struck.

News of the death of the crown prince reached the king of the East. He flew into a rage.\nHe rallied his many troops and ordered those in the north and the south to kill everyone.\nThe final clash of sword and flesh…
This is an item made by an artisan infusing a soul into it.\nThis is a bow with the blessings of the wise.\nThis can exorcise all evil.
The bow had the power of ten men.\nIt was so powerful, it was impossible to draw.
The warrior received the bow from the king to great acclaim of the people as he set out on his campaign.\nAll were joyous at the thought of him ridding them of the evil beings.

Now a demon uses that bow to threaten humanity.\nBrave men were killed as they sought to fight back. The strongest bow in the world had fallen into the hands of the wicked.\nThe evil threat was constant.

I am an unlicensed backstreet doctor. Please don't call me doctor out loud.
I am skilled, but that doesn't make me less of a villain.
I'll treat you if you pay, no matter what horrific crimes you've committed.
I don't shy away from the illegal procedures.
Just contact me, no questions asked.

I went with a prostitute. She was a poor girl who had not been loved by her family and had been abused by her father.\nI took her in. I told her I wanted her to have my children, but she was unsure.\nOne day, she was caught in the wheels of a carriage and died of her injuries.

I brought her to my home and checked her over.
Her external injuries were only the start. Several of her organs were seriously damaged.
There was such a slim chance she could be helped but I would do what I could. I lay down next to her and administered a local anesthetic to myself.
I removed one of my own organs and transplanted it into her body.

Once the surgery was over, her breathing returned to normal.
It was only then that I noticed… The man next to me was me!
Somehow I was inside her breathing body.
I had laughed at stories of souls residing in organs, but it was true!
I could stay here.
And when my child was born, I would be born. It was perfect!

The first prince knew that the king wanted the second son to inherit the family legacy. So the first prince sneaked into his bedchamber and killed his father with the royal sword.\nAn evil eye appeared on the blade and stared at the first prince.\n"I see you." The voice resonated in his head, shaking him to his soul.

The first prince took the throne and ruled justly.\nBut each time he looked at the royal sword, an evil eye stared accusingly back at him.\nHe urged his ministers to look at the sword but they said that they could see nothing unusual.

The king called an exorcist to have the blade exorcised of its evil spirit.\nBut as soon as the ritual was over, the magical eye remained, staring the king down.\nAfter that, the king lost his mind and turned into a tyrant.

The second prince couldn't take it anymore and sneaked into the sleeping chamber to kill his older brother with the royal sword.\nImmediately an evil eye appeared on the blade and stared at the second prince…

The knight was born as the heir to a great school of martial arts. But the rumor was that he was timid and incapable.\nIt was said that his general father had trained him to use a hammer, and so he was efficient with that.

The kingdom was annexed by a neighboring kingdom. A minister was sent to control the day to day running and the king was nothing but a decoration.\nAt around that time, the king's guard commander fell ill and died.\nThe minister replaced him with the son of a general who was rumored to be incapable.

The minister enjoyed falconry.
Just before setting out, there was a lightning strike and the boy who would become a king's guard cried out.
The minister scolded the boy.
During the hunt, the minister released a lion at the king in an attempt to murder him.

The commander wielded the hammer cleanly to kill the lion.
He apprehended the cardinal and collected evidence of the assassination plan. He denounced the neighboring kingdom.
The neighboring kingdom lost their credibility internationally, and withdrew.
The commander made the cardinal complacent and then pulled the rug out from under his feet.
Our meeting tonight is fated. So let me tell you the story of an unimportant violinist.\nI was once a member of a group of famous knights.\nBut seek high and low, and you won't find trace of us now.

Before battle, after a victory, after a loss.
Happy times and sad times.
When there was something to celebrate and when there was nothing to celebrate.
I would play my violin whenever and for whatever, and everyone danced.

That night everyone begged for an encore. I played my violin.\nHowever, the sound startled some birds who then panicked some enemy troops. It was like dominoes…\nThe place was quickly turned into a bloodbath by our knights.
Look. No legs. It's not a great look.\nI cannot leave this plane and I am stuck here as a spirit.\nEvery night I play the violin for everyone even now and even though it killed me.

The locals gathered salt and seafood from the sea for a living.
But there were many tsunamis and the economy suffered for it.
The king asked the lord of the sea to stop the tsunamis from coming.
The whale ignored the king's request and chased him away.

The king spoke to the whale many times.
The whale asserted that it was only the law of nature and the negotiations did not proceed past that.
There was a minister of the opinion that they should use military might but the king refused to take this stance.
As dialog continued, the whale caused many tsunamis.
The minister tried to blow up the whale, but the king stopped him.

The king kept working for a resolution and finally the whale was moved by his efforts, and promised to inform him when a tsunami was approaching.
Soon after that, the tribes that inherited the wilds attacked his land.
The king visited their encampment unarmed to sue for peace.
But the barbarians laughed at him and slaughtered him right there and then.

The whale causes unequalled tsunamis, destroying barbarians.
A few centuries later…
A pioneer discovered a shrine on a lone island deep in the sea. On its altar, he spied a magnificent staff.
There was no one alive by then to tell them that this was the grave of a king who loved peace and the staff had been a gift from the Water Emperor.
Confirm cardiopulmonary arrest of the manufacturer.\nBoot emergency program.\nStarting backups of most important classified data.

My skills even attracted groupies--five girls came with me to the gallery.\nI wanted to put on a show for the girls, but my opponent in the final round didn't give me the chance. Thanks to the stupid mistakes he kept making, I easily left him in the dust.

Victory seemed certain.\nSo I made some mistakes on purpose, just to get the crowd excited.\nBut seeing the mistakes I made seemed to give my opponent a fresh burst of energy, and since my rhythm was out of whack, I messed up the Nagoya Zap, lost my shelters and then my ship.

After my deliberate slip-up, things got more difficult, so I strung together the shortest possible patterns and racked up a new personal best. I had won the championship.\nThe management department gave me award money and a trophy, and a magazine even interviewed me.\nLater, I saw the initials I'd entered on the high score list, "KIT," printed in huge letters in the magazine.

[1P: He rose above 3300 tournament competitors to take the top spot...]\nPlayer YAM has emerged as the victor of the nationwide Space Invaders tournament!\nFor a stunning performance, the victor has received award money and a trophy!

[2P: Interview with the victor]\nQ: How did the final match go?\nMy opponent, KNS, is a well-known player, and I wasn't sure I could win. I came out victorious thanks to sheer luck, because KNS just happened to mess up the Nagoya Zap and lost his ship.

[3P: Interview with the victor]\nQ: Which part of the tournament made the biggest impression on you?\nA: My friend KIT who entered the tournament with me had to go the hospital with a collapsed lung before the preliminaries started. To be honest, he's a better player than me, and it was a shame he had to drop out.

[4P: Interview with the victor]\nQ: How will you spend your award money?\nA: This is a little embarrassing to talk about, but I made a girlfriend at the tournament, so I'm going to use it to take her on a date [laughs].
"Soon there will be nothing left of this village.\nA disease from another kingdom has infected this place, turning people into beasts,\ndevouring everything."

The last words of the woman in the black cloak were, "Get out of this village as soon as you can, before the sickness devours you." Then she ran away as fast as her legs would carry her. I took a close look at the village, and noticed there were three types of people.

Pathetic village people who knew nothing. People who understood everything, in search of a way to coexist with their one-time brethren who had changed completely. People searching for a new, peaceful place before the disease could destroy them... Maybe none of the three were right.

There was an answer.
Before the disease could spread any further, everyone had to be killed.
"What a terrible, sad story..."
My murmured voice had a desolate ring, as if soaked by cold rain.
There is something strange about the village this Halloween.\nTake a walk through the village, and you won't see any children anywhere.
Well, you may see some, but there are shockingly few.\nAnd there are almost no old people either.\nA village with only young adults...there seems to be something else going on.
All the people are the same height.\nThere are only a few different hairstyles.\nThe leaders of the village must rule the place with an iron fist.

Normally the village leader would take charge.\nPeople who rule others with such authority usually make themselves conspicuous. That's what I thought, but—is it true?\nI'm not sure, but what I do know is, there's something fishy going on.
What do you want with me?\nHoho, you want revenge. Not a bad answer.\nI sense destiny has brought us together. After all, you could have chosen anyone.
To my bearer, I grant inhuman strength.\nWith my aid, you will easily obtain the blood-soaked revenge you seek.
But as payment, your soul will be mine for all eternity.\nWhen you perish, you will not be admitted into God's kingdom.\nYou will dwell in the inferno as the devil's slave. Is this what you desire?

Oh, what's that? You say I would gain more by letting you keep your soul and claiming those of the men you kill?
Hahaha, few dare negotiate with me. I admire your gall.
As you wish. Let the greedful pact be sealed!
Swing me, and let me savor the sweet taste of human souls!

Magical Familiar Contract\nArticle 1\nThe Magical Familiar Contract shall be carried out with both parties' consent. Forced servitude may be resisted through any means. Signer is responsible for all harm resulting thereon.

Article 2\n Following the execution of the Contract, compensation shall be paid upon each instance of servitude. Compensation shall consist of granting whatever the Familiar desires. Payments through magic shall be increased by twenty percent.

Article 3\nIn the event that Familiar dies due to negligence or mishandling by Attendant, Attendant shall expend the magical power/vitality necessary to revive Familiar. Rights to material benefits resulting from Familiar's powers revert to Signer.

Article 4\nIn the event of a contractual violation by Signer, Familiar may devour Signer's soul and/or body. In the event of a contractual violation by Familiar, Signer obtains Familiar's power and soul. Subsequent rebellion by said soul does not constitute a contractual violation.

The people say it is a type of ghost.
Most of the sightings occur on the night of the new moon,
but the reason for this is not known.
The most convincing explanation so far is that the "ghost"
is actually the light of far-off lanterns.

It emerges from the darkness and just stands there in front of you.
It doesn't do anything but stand there,
and stare at you with its vacant eyes. 
Dawn breaks, and the sun sets again,
and still it stands there silently.

You even see it standing there in your dreams.
There is only one way to break free from it:
death.
By suicide, by accident, by any other way.
How you die doesn't matter. Death is the only way out.

And when you die, it quietly goes away.
Then, on the next new moon, it appears before someone else.
And it only appears to people who know the story.

Now that you know, you may be next.

A blade unearthed from the wasteland.
Too big to be called a sword, too heavy to fight with, too ugly to be cermonial.
What was it for?
It left the archaeologists scratching their heads.

When they researched the site where the blade was dug up, and referenced documents from the same time period,
they came upon a story about the blade.
The knight who had owned the blade
had single-handedly wiped out two whole enemy kingdoms.

They analyzed the blade to find out what it was made of, and to their surprise,
they found it contained not only steel, but also human blood and bits of bone.
The archaeologists believed the blade had been made of the weapons and bodies of dead men,
to serve as a warning against war.

War broke out, and the archaeologists found out the tale was true.
The knight appeared in the storeroom where the blade was kept, exactly as the ancient documents described him.
He claimed to represent the legion of souls that resided in the sword.
They would never rest, explained the knight, until humanity realized the foolishness of war.
My name is the Black Book. Are you the king who will lead the world to salvation? Don't be so surprised, Your Majesty. For me, it is a simple matter to speak human words.

I sympathize with your distress, Your Majesty. On this occasion, however, we have no choice but to let them deal with your sister. When sorrow overtakes you, you may come to me and speak of your tribulations.
Reading is an admirable pursuit. Your Majesty—for me?? I shall peruse this volume if it comes on your recommendation... What is that? You think it odd for a book to read a book?

Noir? I would prefer to dispense with this nickname. My name, Your Majesty, is the Black Book. I am a grand tome of human wisdom... thus, to refer to me by such a curious moniker is, dare I say, inappropriate.

The people in the church murmured prayers, their eyes fixed on an ominous stone carving of a bull's head. A solemn atmosphere hung over the chapel. The worshipers were praying to select a sacrifice to offer to god. Following a long silence, the priest announced the sacred mandate: a shy young girl would serve as the sacrifice. Tears streamed down her cheeks as the priest let her down a corridor into the inner sanctum.

The crowd filed out, and silence settled again over the chapel. A boy stood there in a daze. He had been the childhood playmate of the girl who had been chosen as the sacrifice, and he had always had a crush on her. She was so shy, so quiet, and he was determined to watch over her. He could never forget the memory of her smiling face, which she had shown to him alone. After making sure the coast was clear, the boy crept into the inner sanctum.

At the end a dimly lit corridor, the boy spied a light on inside a room. He peeked in and saw the girl all alone, crying. The boy took her hand, and they ran from the church. It's okay, it's okay, I'll never leave you, he gently assured her as she sobbed, shoulders heaving. But the girl did not respond. She just hung her head, mumbling beneath her breath.\n

The girl's voice gradually got louder and finally turned to screams. "God, at last, you've chosen me! Give me all your love, more and more and more and more and..." As tears of joy streamed down her face, she drew out the sharp bull's horn she had secreted away and stabbed herself in the heart. The bloodstained bull's horn gleamed vividly, looking almost alive. \n

The man went to war for the sake of his beloved wife. On the battlefield, his chest was slashed and his belly was split open, but nothing could bring him to his knees. He was an immortal warrior. He wasn't gifted with any special physical ability, so if he weren't immortal, how could he have made it through?

The man had been immortal since he crossed paths with a small, beautiful bird one fateful day. Moved by the man's devotion to his wife, the bird had said to him, holding out a feather, "Carry this feather with you, and you will live to see your loved one again."

When the war ended, the man collected his payment and returned to live with his wife in the village. They lived in such poverty he couldn't even afford clothes for his wife. Nonetheless, his love for her gave him a reason to live.

Once again, the man went to war for the sake of his beloved wife. On the battlefield, his chest was slashed and his belly was split open, and he fell down dead. That very day, back in the village, the man's wife had gone to a merchant and sold his beloved beautiful bird feather.

Flames swallowed the house, leaping up as if to burn the black night sky. The boy barely escaped, but his father, his mother, his siblings, and everything he owned went up in flames. All the boy was left with was a battleaxe the bandits had left behind, and the burn marks on his body. He waited for the wounds to heal, cursing the gods for condemning him to this fate.

The boy grew up to be a man, but still the burns did not heal. He tried all types of medicine, but there seemed to be no hope of recovery. Each time he brushed away the maggots gnawing on the scars, the pain would flare back up, and he would sink into a foul mood. Searching for a way to forget the pain, the young man joined a band of mercenaries. He realized that the moment his sword descended on an enemy, then and only then did the pain ease. He had finally found an escape from his suffering.

Hired to fight in a conflict with a neighboring kingdom, the mercenaries laid waste to an enemy village. The young man wildly swung the battleax, determined to force his pain on others, to drown his suffering in the murderous ecstasy of war. He burst inside a home, beheaded the father as he pleaded for his life, hacked the mother's body to bits while shouting curses, and tossed the baby into the burning stove. For a short time, he forgot the pain of the burns.

Swept up in the ecstasy of slaughter, he lit fire to the room where the corpses lay, just for fun. On his way out, he spied a young girl standing near the burning home, crying. The moment he laid eyes on her, he remembered the fire of his youth that had taken everything from him, and the pain of the burn wounds flared up. Understanding there was only one way to end this suffering, he lit himself on fire, and handed the bloodstained battleax to the girl.
The king sung the praises\nof the eternal kingdom and the sun that would never set.
The queen sung the praises\nof the great king and his marvelous achievements.
The prince sung the praises\nof the staunchly loyal soldiers, always marching forward.
The jester just sung a song,\nridiculing the three members of the royal family who had rested on their laurels and met their doom.
She was slender, with smooth, white skin.\nThe hint of a dark shadow in her expression highlighted her beautiful features.\nBut something about the sword in her hand didn't seem to fit the picture.
Anger, sorrow, hatred.\nWhen emotions overwhelmed her, she would swing the sword, so there was never a lack of blood to quench its thirst.\nThe problem was that she couldn't put the sword down.
A heart and body in constant conflict.\nNo one in the world could understand her.\nAnd loneliness was eating her alive.
The long war came to an end, and darkness devoured her.\nBut her heart remained at peace.\nBecause she faced fate in the arms of the one she loved.
